title: A Decade of Multi-Beam SEM Technology – Celebrating the 10th Anniversary of MultiSEM
content: Ten years ago, the first commercially available multi-beam SEM has been introduced to the public [1]. Since then, the technology has gained interest, especially in research fields demanding ultra-high throughput acquisition of image data. At the forefront is the field of Connectomics in Neurobiology which aims at reconstructing large volumes of the brain to understand its structure and function [2, 3]. This large-scale imaging of biological tissue sections was enabled by the development of automated sample preparation techniques [4–7] which has gained momentum in recent years.
